chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The Java Debugger plugin provides the necessary support to debug java programs from with in the jEdit. You can debug both Java Applications and Applets using the debugger. The Plugin is based the JPDA APIs provided by the Sun.

chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: Follow these steps in using the debugger:

itemizedlist.listitem: Use the javacore plugin to select the classpath source for the debugger. If you are using 'JavaDebugger' itself as the classpath source then set the sourcepath and classpath from the JavaDebugger options menu.
Open the debugger dockable window from the Plugin menu.
Click on the start button from the debugger toolbar on the top.

chapter.title: Stepping through code
chapter.para: Use the debugger toolbar on the top to step through the code.

chapter.title: Features of Debugger Dockable
chapter.para: The Java Debugger dockable window has the following panels. Note that you can turn off individual panel via the General options of Java Debugger from the Plugin Options menu.

itemizedlist.listitem: I/O Panel : Displays the standard output and standard error of the program. Allows you to input values to the standard input of the program

Thread Panel : Displays the threads in the running program as a tree. Once the program is suspended you can select individual stack frames to view the source as well as view the data in that frame. Further you can select the 'Pop Frame' option to pop out all the stack frame above a given frame.

Breakpoint Panel : Displays the list of breakpoints. You can add/remove breakpoints from here. Further you can enable/disable individual breakpoints. For source breakpoints you can browse the source code.
Watchonit Panel : Displays the watchpoints. You can add/remove watchpoints from here. Further you can enable/disable individual watchpoints.

Data Panel : Displays the local varaibles and member variables of the current stack frame. Changing the active stack frame via the threads panel updates the data being displayed. Further for primitive types (e.g: int, String etc.) you can modify the values
Message Panel : Primarily for debugging purposes. It dispalys the events in the debugger as you run through the program.
